location: SE Cedar Rapids, Cedar Rapids, Iowa
postcontent: For sale is my beautiful S&W .357 magnum revolver. This is a K-frame(midsize) revolver based on the Model 19 Combat Magnum but produced in stainless steel. When the Model 19 came out it was called the "the answer to a peace officer's dream" by Bill Jordan, a well-known border patrol officer and exhibition shooter. The reason for this was its powerful cartridge combined with easier handling over the larger N-frames and excellent accuracy and reliability.  It comes with the stock small grips as well as large right-handed shooter target grips. The gun features the classic white-outline adjustable rear sight with the orange-insert front. It is wonderfully accurate and will shoot less expensive(and less powerful) .38 Specials in addition to the .357. The price is somewhat negotiable and I'm also interested in partial trades for an 870 shotgun or '67-72 Chevy pickup parts. Buyer must have a permit to purchase and will get a bill of sale.

title: For Sale:  410 Browning BPS Hunter Pump Action Shotgun 26" Barrel 3" Chamber 4 Rounds Satin Finish Walnut Stock Blued Finish LN
postcontent:
Lightly used (maybe 3 shells fired) soft case included.410 Bore Browning BPS Hunter Pump Action Shotgun 26" Barrel 3" Chamber 4 Rounds Satin Finish Walnut Stock Blued Finish.

Specifications and features:
Browning BPS Hunter pump shotgun
.410 Bore
26" back-bored barrel
Vent rib
3" chamber
4 round capacity
Ambidextrous, thumb top tang safety
Dual, machined steel action bars
Forged & machined steel receiver
Bottom ejection
Heat treated steel double slide bars
Serrated slide release
Standard Invector choke tubes
Satin finish walnut stock
Blued barrel
14-1/4" length of pull
1-5/8" drop at comb
1-7/8" drop at heel
46-3/4" overall length
5/16" rib
7 lbs unloaded

BPS. A solid steel reputation for durability and dependability. Few firearms ever earn the level of respect the Browning BPS boasts. The BPS has a solid reputation for long-lasting durability and an uncanny ability to keep on working in spite of what Mother Nature does to stop it. This shouldn't come as a surprise because the BPS has what most other pump shotguns don't - features like rigid dual machined steel action bars, a forged and machined steel receiver, a convenient top-tang safety and bottom ejection for ambidextrous operation, and legendary Browning balance and handling. That's why the BPS continues to be the pump shotgun serious shotgunners like you can always rely on.

Bottom ejection throws empty shells straight down, out of the line of sight, and makes the BPS the ultimate pump for right- or left-handed shooters. Bottom loading provides operating convenience.

The proven pump-action design of the BPS is sound and reliable. All components are durably constructed of solid steel and are housed inside a receiver machined from a solid block of forged steel. Rigid double slide bars are made from heat-treated steel and eliminate twisting and binding for faster, more efficient operation. The result is smooth operation in all conditions and the ability to stay on target while delivering rapid follow-up shots. A convenient serrated slide release is located at the rear of the trigger guard.

The thumb-operated, top-tang safety on the BPS can be easily operated by right- and left-handed shooters alike, even with gloved fingers.

.410 bore BPS shotguns include the Standard Invector™ system.

postcontent:
Franchi SPAS 15 dual mode 12 gauge assault style shotgun complete with one magazine, solid and additional folding stock as shown.



Gun can be fired in semi automatic mode with conventional ammunition or in manual pump mode for less powerful LTL (less than lethal) rounds such as beanbag, rubber slug or rubber pellets.  I understand there may be a Tazer like round coming in the near future


Magazine holds six 2 3/4" twelve gauge shells and barrel is threaded to accept a variety of screw on chokes for various applications.  There are no screw on chokes included with this gun.

As you know only 180 or so of  these "evil looking" shotguns were imported in the 1980s before being banned.  Enough said !

title: For Sale:  CZ 75 SP-01 Shadow (Custom Shop)
postcontent:
Wife is pregnant and the situation dictates I must sell this beauty. 

For sale: This is a CZ 75 SP-01 Shadow custom built and tuned by Angus Hobdell from the CZ Custom shop in AZ. I had this built up for dual purpose carry and competition shooting in USPSA. It's similar in weight to a railed 1911 and is a real pussycat shooting 9mm. 

This is a DA/SA with a safety instead of a decocker, so you can carry it cocked and locked SAO, or manually decock it and carry it DA/SA. 

It features:

- Fit frame and slide
- Trigger and Action job
- Competition Hammer
- Trijicon Night Sights w/ serrated rear
- Ambi Safety
- Extended Mag Release
- Full Length Steel Guide Rod
- Extended Firing Pin for increased reliability
- CZ 85 Combat Original Trigger to eliminate trigger pinch (Has overtravel adjustment screw, currently loc-tighted) 

The single action pull is 3 lb. 4 oz.
Double action is 8 lb. 7 oz. and incredibly smooth.

I've got 4 mags to send with it. 2 16 rounders for concealed carry and 2 19 rounders for competition, duty, or your favorite apocalypse scenario. The 16 rounders fit flush to the frame, while the 19 rounders add about half an inch.

Also to go with it is a comp-tac CTAC IWB holster for comfortable concealed carry.

Comes with the original box and all paperwork, including a factory shot target and warranty.

Like new with only 150 rounds of Federal Champion through it (I would not consider it broken in) and is more accurate than my M&P could ever hope to be.

I've got just over $1400 in it excluding the cost of the holster. I would like $1150 for the whole works.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Civil War Revolvers:  The Pride of the North and South.
postcontent:
Two 36 Cal. Civil War  Cap n’ Ball Revolvers Representing the North and South in Excellent Condition. A Total Investment of Over $800..  Take a look at the Pictures. Made to Original Details and Specs, these Italian made Replica Revolvers would make an Outstanding Display in your Den, Office or Living Room when Not on the Range Driving Nails. Sweet and Accurate Shooters. Load Up Six Rounds Each and Enjoy Firing your Smoke Wagons. Unbelievable Firepower, Accuracy and Range.
Used Twice in Competition over the last 20 sum odd years. Well Cared For Weapons.

  For the North is the 1861 Navy Colt. This model was preferred by many Cavalrymen for its easy handling and modest recoil. The 1861 Navy Model Colt is a good design; lighter, shorter, and handier than the .44 1860 Army Model. This pistol is a sleek and good handling revolver. Plinkers and Cowboy Competitors alike will appreciate the handling and modest recoil. The gun is mounted with a Blade Front Sight, and a Case-Hardened V Notched Hammer Rear Sight, Blue Barrel, Color Case-Hardened Rammer and Frame. The Top of the Barrel is Stamped, Replica Arms Inc. Marietta - Ohio - Made in Italy.

  Representing the South is the Spiller and Burr Revolver. One of the rarest Civil War revolvers prized by collectors today. Only 1451 revolvers were actually produced from the 15,000 guns commissioned by the CSA. The barrel is a blued 7" tapered octagon 1 in 30" twist. Comes with a brass bead front sight and has a V-notch in top strap for Rear Sight. Features Brass Frame and Trigger Guard with Color Case-Hardened Hammer. Manufactured in Italy for Dixie Gun Works by Palmetto Arms.

Sale includes the Key Lockable Case, Powder Measuring and Loading Accessories as well as Nipple "T" Tool, Cleaning Rod, Percussion Caps and 36 Cal.(.375) Hornady Round Balls. Everything needed to Fire and Maintain these Two Pistols.

title: For Trade:  FOR Trade: ANIB Marlin 1895 Cowboy
postcontent:
I have a unfired in the box Marlin 1895 Cowboy rifle in .45-70 calibre. I am looking to trade for like condition fire arms. Considered trades are:

Winchester Model 94 in .44 magnum versions such as Trails End, Trapper, Legacy, S.R.C.. I will not be super picky about the cross bolt safety or angle eject if the condition is there but prefer tang or no safety and top eject models.

Henry Big Boy in ANIB condition.

A brace of ANIB Ruger Vaqueros in .357 mag or .45 LC. Blue or Stainless with 5.5" barrel length. I will consider the 7.5" barrel length in the .45LC.

Other options are CMP service grade or professionally restored M1903/ A3, WWII K98k German made Mauser w/ matching numbers (non match bolt OK but no RC guns), CMP service grade M1 Garand. 

It is OK if you have fired your guns but condition is everything to me as is originality, I strongly prefer unmodified guns so no scopes, no slicked up actions, no holster wear and absolutely no rust.

I will include new factory ammo as part of the trade if you will too.

I put trade value in the $650 to $800 range with ammo. I will trade up or down if you have what I like and I hope you will too.

title: For Sale:  Taurus Judge Public Defender 2" Barrel 2.5" Chamber Gun Firearm
postcontent:
Judge
The newest version of the Judge might just revolutionize small frame revolvers. The Model 4510 Public Defender delivers the same devastating firepower in a new scaled-down size that can travel with you. Available in a carbon steel or stainless steel frame and with the option of a Titanium cylinder, the new Public Defender also features a reduced profile hammer that won't catch when it needs to come out quickly.
Extended Ejector Rod
For positive extraction of fired cases.
rubber Grip
Exclusive Taurus ergonomic shock absorbing grip design provides a firm grip under virtually all shooting conditions.
Taurus Security System (TSS)rs
Taurus family of semi-auto pistols all feature the Taurus Security System, which provides instant-ready defense with built-in ability to secure your pistol and make it inoperable at the turn of a key. When the Security System is engaged, the pistol cannot be fired or cocked and the gun's manual safety cannot be disengaged. As with our revolver Security System, the device is part of the firearm and cannot be lost, and the same special Security Key works for both the revolver and pistol Systems (two keys come with each gun). To engage: simply insert the Key into the button on the rear or side of the pistol and rotate one-quarter turn clockwise. This engages the Security System. The manual safety cannot be moved and the trigger cannot be pulled. To disengage: simply rotate the key one-quarter turn back. This releases the Security System, yet leaves the pistol's manual safety in the "safe" position until you are ready to release it yourself and fire the gun.
Transfer Bar
The transfer bar mechanism prevents the hammer from striking the firing pin unless the trigger is pulled fully to the rear.
Fiber Optic Sight
Light gathering tubes are inserted into the sight to offer the shooter the highly visible dot created by the end of the fiber optic
Model: 4510PD-3B Finish: Blue Status: Available Caliber: .45/.410 (2.5" chamber) Grips: Ribber UPC: 7-25327-60708-3 Capacity: 5 Weight: 28.2 oz Barrel Length: 2.5" Frame: Small Action: SA/DA Front Sight: Red Fiber Optic Fixed Length: 9" Grooves: 6 Safety: Taurus Security System,Transfer Bar Trigger Type: Smooth Order #: 2-441031TC MSRP: $602.00

title: For Sale:  Browning A-5 12 ga Auto Magnum Shotgun, Engraved w/ Checkered Stock, mfg 1958; 95%+
postcontent:
I have a beautiful Browning A-5 12 Gauge 3” Magnum.  It’s in excellent condition.  According to the serial number of 18XXX, I’m told it was made in 1958 or ‘59.  On one side of the barrel it says “Made in Belgium”, and on the other side it states “Special Steel – 12 Gauge – 3” Magnum”.   The shotgun retains all most all of it’s original bluing and has very nice checkered furniture.  The stock and blued steel have very minimal wear, not cracks or large scratches, and overall looks wonderful.  It looks more like a couple year old gun that’s sat in the safe most of its life, not the 54 year old firearm that it is!  It also has the desirable magazine cutoff, so you can keep the magazine loaded, and load one shell at a time.  I don’t see a marking for the choke... my assumption it that it’s full choke because it shoots a nice tight group.  It is equipped with a long 31” barrel.  The action reduces felt recoil tremendously, so that it’s really a pleasure to shoot.  Sorry about the pics; because the bluing is so good, it seems to suck up the light.  In a couple of pictures it looks like a gun that retains less bluing, but rest assured that it is just my lack of skill with the camera, not the gun.  Please shoot me an e-mail (no pun intended!) if you want to come take a look.   Thanks for looking!

By the way, I might be going down I-5 to Federal Way tomorrow (Tuesday 8/28) and can bring this with me if someone is interested.

title: For Sale:  Browning X Bolt Medallion 300 Win Mag
postcontent:
Browning X Bolt Medallion
You don't want to be embarrassed with a sub-par rifle on any hunt. And perhaps this is the year you need to upgrade your hunting rifle. The X-Bolt Medallion bolt action rifle is presented with a fine gloss-finished, checkered walnut stock. The steel receiver is engraved and has a blued finish for beauty and durability. Insuring long-range accuracy is the totally free-floated barrel and Feather Trigger System, two of the most critical components of any high-powered hunting rifle. Action of the bolt is sure, smooth and secure. Rounds fed from the detachable box magazine align the bullet straight with the chamber providing reliable smooth feeding. This way, cartridges push directly in-line with the bore, sure, simple and secure. Many other high-powered, bolt-action rifles may catch your eye. But feature-to-feature, the X-Bolt Medallion has more critical features to help you shoot straight and bag that deer every time, confidently, accurately.
Receiver - Steel • Engraved with blued finish • Glass bedded • Drilled and tapped for scope mounts
Barrel - Blued finish • Free floating • Hand chambered • Target Crown
Action - Bolt-action • 60º bolt lift • Adjustable Feather Trigger™ • Detachable rotary magazine • Top-tang safety with Bolt Unlock Button
Stock - Gloss finish Walnut stock • Rosewood fore-end grip and pistol grip cap

title: For Sale:  New Savage MKIIFV 22LR with Scope. GREAT VALUE
postcontent:
The famous Mark II FV from Savage!! You get so much gun for your money with this company, and a top of the line warranty. I Built this for competition shooting. Tasco 6x24 mill dot scope, Warne competition scope rings, and Kodiak Limbsaver strap. This gun is new and has had less than 25 rounds shot through it (built it, then got into a car accident). Most accurate .22 LR you will find for silhouette shooting or hunting. Free float, bull barrel which means no rattle when firing unlike it's more expensive counterparts (ahem ruger 10-22). I have modified the trigger to make it a 2lbs pull. This gun is a steal from the casual hunter to the competition shooter. Thumb safety and .22 caliber make it a GREAT first rifle for the young'ins too. It is super clean and so new it comes with a Savage Arms warranty. I have no use for it this season as I just got major left hand/arm surgery that will keep me out of the game for a good amount of time. Costed me well over $450.00 to assemble, not to mention taxes and fees. Which we all know are a killer on any firearm or accessories. With ammo as expensive as it is, now is the time to get a .22 that's accurate, fun, and cheap to shoot. The money you save from shooting this caliber alone will save you.

title: For Sale:  RAAC MK 1919 Camo
postcontent:
RAAC  MK1919 Semi-Automatic 12 Gauge

The Akdal MKA 1919 is a gas operated, semi-automatic shotgun.  The MKA 1919                                                      not only resembles the M16 rifle
but the control and function are similar.  The MKA 1919 is unlike any other
12 gauge shotgun in the U.S. as it is very light, ergonomic, and magazine
fed.  The MKA 1919 semi-automatic shotgun uses a conventional gas-operated
action which is located around the support tube that runs below the barrel.
 The return spring is also located around the same support tube which is
concealed by an enlarged polymer handguard.  The MKA 1919 barrel can be
very easily removed from the upper receiver.   The upper receiver is
manufactured from an aluminum alloy while the lower receiver, pistol grip,
and stock are manufactured as one piece from impact resistant polymer.  The
MKA 1919 comes with two 5-round metal detachable magazines and 3 internal
chokes.  The magazine release button mimics the M16 rifle location.  The
manual safety also duplicates the M16 style being located on the left side
of the receiver above the pistol grip.  The top of the receiver has a
carrying handle and  integral picatinny rail for mounting rear sights, or
any optical accessories.  The MKA 1919 12 gauge shotgun is appropriate for
all levels of hunting and sporting enthusiasts.

SPECIFICATIONS:
Action                 :Semi-Automatic
Gauge                 :12
Barrel Length    :18.5"
Capacity             :5+1
Length              :38"

title: For Trade:  Modified AK47
postcontent:
I have for trade and trade only a modified AK47.  This is a Romanian G series AK, 7.62x39.  It's in great shape, stamped receiver recently repainted flat black with Alumahyde II.  The following is a list of modifications:

-Tapco Cage Style compensator
-UTG Quad Rail, painted Coyote Tan
-Magpul AFG
-Vltor IMOD Clubfoot buttstock with cheekrest/battery storage addons, Coyote Tan
-AKARA AR to AK pistol grip adapter
-Magpul MIAD Pistol Grip with interchangeable backstraps and grips, Coyote Tan
-Texas Weapon Systems dustcover with built in picatinny rail system (Very unique part, www.texasweaponsystems.com, check it out)
-6 Tapco 30 round magazines, Flat Dark Earth
-Original wooden furniture
-Soviet Bayonet
-Solar Tactical MFER (Magazine well enhancement, helps with fast, no look reloads)
-Krebs Custom Enhanced safety for one-finger manipulation

This rifle has been tailored to be an easy fit for someone used to an AR platform, and as you can see, I didn't just slap a Tapco furniture kit on it and call it pimped.  All these parts can be removed with simple tools, no permanent modifications have been made.  I've had a TON of fun with this rifle but I think it's time to work on an AR style platform, and the money to buy another one outright just isn't there.  Email for pics.  I'm not in a hurry to be rid of this rifle in any way, so please be fair in your offers.

title: For Sale:  NIB Lee Precision Pro-1000 reloading press .45 ACP
postcontent:
New in the box and available for sale. Lee Precision Pro-1000 progressive reloading press set up for .45ACP

Add a bullet and pull the lever; all other operations are automatic. One loaded cartridge with each pull of the lever. Every operation is automatic. Primers, like the powder, are fed only if a case is present. No wasted primers or spilled powder. Alternate loading sequence lets you load only one case at a time. Makes learning easy for the first time user and great for fine adjustments or experimenting. You can start reloading good ammunition minutes after the press is bolted down. Change calibers in just 3 minutes.

Comes with powder thrower, primer feeding tray, 4 position (adjustable) brass feeder, and 45ACP dies. 

Available for local pick up in Gilroy. Tax due (8.25%) on this item at time of sale.

title: For Sale:  Kansas Concealed Carry Class
postcontent:
IRON SIGHTS, Benton, KS, Barb & Harold Mistler instructors. 

Live ammunition is not allowed in the class room. 

The next Kansas Concealed Carry class is Saturday, September 8th, 2012 

0745 to 1700 class starts at 8:00am. Fee is $75.00. Prior to class. 

All firearms will be inspected prior to class. If you do not have a handgun, 

we can provide one for your live fire part of the training. 

Approved Course Curriculum: 8 Hour class according to Kansas law. 

1. Introduction a. Welcome b. Class Safety Briefing c. Class Objectives 
2. Introduction to Handguns, safe handling & storage of firearms. 
3. Handgun care and maintenance. 
4. The use of deadly force. 
5. Concealed carry & Kansas law. 
6. Firearm manipulation, Marksmanship & Practice. 
7. Written test. (25 questions) 
8. Range qualification. 5 shots at 3 yards one handed. 


10 shots at 7 yards two handed, 10 shots at 10 yards two handed. 

25 shots total. 

9. Overall evaluation. Pass/Fail 


We will have a 30 min lunch break. Please bring a sack lunch. 

We are in a remote area, there is no place close by to go & grab 
Some thing to eat. Water and soft drinks provided. 

We are looking forward to teaching you. 

Iron Sights. Please call and register, Harold REDACTED 

 Email: REDACTED           www.ironsights.org

title: For Sale:  DANIEL DEFENSE M4v5 .300 BlackOut URG NO SIGHTS
location: East Bend (336)692-0317   ssw, Winston Salem, North Carolina
postcontent:
Model:  M4v5 Upper Receiver Group

Caliber:   .300 Blackout

Barrel Length:  16"

Color:  Black

Sights: None

Daniel Defense’s new caliber option, the 300 Blackout, was originally designed to give the shooter a 30 caliber projectile which could be fired out of the AR platform without an increase in magazine size while still utilizing a standard bolt. The 300 Blackout is 7.62x35mm which gives the shooter similar ballistic qualities as the .308 and the 7.62x39mm, the AK round, without having to give up the light weight 5.56mm/AR platform.  The 300 Blackout can still utilize in standard AR magazines without a reduction in magazine capacity. Unlike the 7.62x39mm, the 300 Blackout cartridge is still light on the shoulder with similar recoil to the 5.56mm.

The Daniel Defense, v5-300 AAC Blackout Complete Upper Receiver Group comes in two different configurations no sights or fixed front/rear sights.

The 300 BlackOut is designed to be shot suppressed and un-surpressed utilizing various type of super sonic and sub sonic ammunitions.  The testing of the Daniel Defense 300 BlackOut firearms indicates that un-surpressed firing with sub-sonic ammo can lead to failures to feed, failures, to eject, and failures to fire and is not recommend.  Although, though our extensive testing we did ascertain that the utilization of a "H" weight buffer or lighter when shooting un-surpressed sub-sonic ammo produces much more reliable operation.

Materials & Construction
Precision crafted from the highest quality material available today with meticulous attention to detail, The Daniel Defense M4 Carbine will prove to be the benchmark in the industry.

•Upper Receiver: Mil-Spec with Indexing Marks and M4 Feed Ramps
•Barrel: Chrome Moly Vanadium Steel, Cold Hammer Forged, 1:8 twist, 16? S2W Profile, Carbine Gas System, MP tested, and Salt Bath Nitride Finished.
•Chamber: 300 AAC Blackout

•Handguard: Daniel Defense DDM4 Rail™ 12.0

•Made in the USA!

title: For Sale/Trade:  yugo milled sks w/ grenade launcher sight, bayonet lug 30rnd clips RARE
postcontent:
i made this ad for a buddy of mine because he asked me too,
it is a yugo milled sks with grenade launcher sight and bayonet lug with a tactical dragunov buttstock on it. it is  not stamped like some of the cheaper sks' ak's 
this one is made from a solid blocks of steel that are milled out to shape and size used to build it and not from a flat sheet of steel heat treated and bent into shape this thing is heavy duty and is a non used military surplus gun.


it has 2 30 round detachable clips. is highly similar to the one in the photo.

1 is a tapco and one is steel surplus.

looking to trade for a saiga unconverted rifle/shotgun. prefer those in 7.62x39

this gun has no problems and has been tooken care of and cleaned after every gun range visit. have only shot 500 rounds through it. has strong rifleing and bore and is a accurate gun. hit paper out to about 200 yards with iron sights i have no doubt it would have shot further but that was the furtherst that the gun range had.

 it has the bayonet lug but there is no bayonet. there are 75 round drums for this gun and also many different stock sets similar to the ak. the sks is the cheaper alternative and is almost the same.

 has adjustable sight aperture for elevation distance and has a bolt hold open feature within the magazine. im not for sure but i also belive that this rifle has a last round bolt hold open feature as well. 


if i get the time or chance to do it for my friend i was going to do some light fileing to the bolt carrier and this would allow it to accept magazines with the bolt face closed like the ak 

there is a scope mount that utg tactical makes that holds zero that is under 35-40$ or cheaper i belive. there is also numerous alternatives all over ebay.

there is also a special bipod made specifically for this gun for under 25$ on gunbroker last time i looked that clamps down on the bayonet lug.

you could in theory go and get the scope mount , a decent scope and the bipod and have a sks/dragunov looking type gun. but my friend wants a saiga rifle like i do because i have converted them and have the tools and told him i would help him to do it.

he also will sell it for 450 or best offer now low ball offers not worth time you can look up the value of this gun, with the aftermarket stock and the simple possible modification i mentiond thats all over youtube it is well worth the price.

just respond to the add and reach me via email, if we reach a good sale/trade agreement we can then contact eachother via phone ect....and discuss it. thanks for looking
